5.description: Revealed to be Isildur's heir and the rightful king of Gondor and Arnor. Called Elessar by Galadriel, he carries the sword Andúril, reforged from the shards of Narsil. Leads the hunt for the captured hobbits with grim determination.
Continues to track the Uruk-hai with his keen elven senses, reading signs in the earth and air that others cannot detect. His friendship with Gimli deepens through their shared trials.
Despite his shorter legs, keeps pace with his companions in the pursuit of the Uruk-hai. His friendship with Legolas continues to grow, overcoming ancient prejudices between Elves and Dwarves.

11.description: Travels with Sam toward Mordor, bearing the increasing burden of the Ring. The Ring's weight grows heavier both physically and spiritually as they near the land of its creation.
Remains utterly devoted to Frodo despite the growing dangers and his master's increasing burden. His practical nature and loyalty provide strength when Frodo begins to falter.

Captured by Frodo and Sam while following them. Swears by the Ring to guide them to Mordor, though his true intentions remain suspect. Shows signs of his original Sméagol personality alongside his corrupted Gollum side.

5.description: Returns transformed as Gandalf the White after his battle with the Balrog. More powerful than before, he has taken Saruman's place as head of the White Council. His mission is clearer and more urgent.

relationships.Saruman: Has replaced as head of order

4.description: Captured along with Merry by Uruk-hai after Boromir's death. Shows resourcefulness by dropping his elven brooch as a sign for potential rescuers. Endures the harsh treatment of his captors.
Captured with Pippin by Uruk-hai. Shows quick thinking and courage despite their dire situation. Works with Pippin to leave signs for their friends and seeks opportunities for escape.

3.description: Revealed as a traitor who has turned to darkness. Once the head of the White Council, he now seeks the Ring for himself. Commands vast armies of Uruk-hai from his stronghold of Isengard.

4.description: An Ent, one of the ancient Tree-shepherds of Middle-earth. Tall as a tree himself, with bark-like skin and leaves in his hair. Speaks slowly and deliberately, as Ents measure time differently than the 'hasty' younger races.

2.description: A Marshal of Rohan who leads a company of Riders pursuing the Uruk-hai. Nephew to King Théoden, he is tall and stern with a spear and shield. His éored destroyed the orc-band but found no hobbits among the slain.

6.description: King of Rohan, fallen under the influence of his counselor Wormtongue and seeming old and frail beyond his years. Gandalf breaks the spell upon him, restoring his strength and will to fight.
Théoden's counselor who has been poisoning the king's mind with lies and doubt. Pale and cringing, with a wheedling voice. Revealed to be Saruman's spy within Edoras, weakening Rohan from within.

1.description: Dies valiantly defending Merry and Pippin from the Uruk-hai, though he cannot prevent their capture. His final act redeems his earlier attempt to take the Ring from Frodo.

16.description: The Lady of Lothlórien, one of the mightiest of the Eldar in Middle-earth. Keeper of Nenya, one of the Three Rings of the Elves. Her wisdom and power are renowned throughout the land.
Lord of Lothlórien and consort to Galadriel. An Elf-lord of great wisdom and nobility, ruling the Golden Wood alongside his lady.

14.description: Captain of the Rangers of Ithilien and younger son of Denethor. Unlike his brother Boromir, he is not tempted by the Ring's power. Wise and noble, with a deep love for his homeland.
One of Faramir's Rangers of Ithilien. A skilled woodsman who helps capture Frodo and Sam, bringing them to the hidden base at Henneth Annûn.
One of Faramir's trusted Rangers of Ithilien. A loyal soldier of Gondor who serves in the dangerous border lands, watching for enemies from Mordor.

15.description: A Ranger of Ithilien stationed at Henneth Annûn. Guards the hidden waterfall entrance and maintains watch over the secret base.

9.description: Lord of Westfold who arrives with Gandalf and reinforcements at dawn to break the siege of Helm's Deep. His timely arrival helps route Saruman's army.

relationships.Rohan: Lord and defender of western lands

7.description: An old warrior of Rohan who serves as one of Théoden's trusted captains. Helps organize the defense of Helm's Deep with his experience in warfare.

6.description: The doorward of Théoden's hall, responsible for the king's safety. Shows wisdom in allowing Gandalf to keep his staff, recognizing the wizard's true nature.

3.description: A large Uruk-hai who leads the band that captured Merry and Pippin. Serves Saruman directly and fights with other orcs over the hobbits' fate. Killed by Éomer's riders.
An orc from Mordor who travels with Uglúk's band. Suspicious that the hobbits carry something valuable for his master Sauron. Conflicts with Uglúk over orders.

4.description: A younger Ent who is 'hasty' by Ent standards. More quick to anger than other Ents, especially about the destruction of trees. Joins the attack on Isengard.

5.description: The chief of the Mearas, the great horses of Rohan. Silver-grey and incredibly swift, he bears Gandalf and understands speech. No rider save Gandalf can master him.

21.description: An enormous spider that dwells in the tunnel of Torech Ungol. Ancient and evil, she feeds on all living things that enter her domain. Gollum plans to feed the hobbits to her.

relationships.Gollum: Used by as trap for hobbits

14.description: The Ruling Steward of Gondor and father of Boromir and Faramir. A proud and stern ruler who bears the burden of defending Gondor against Mordor's growing power.

6.description: Niece of King Théoden and sister to Éomer. A lady of Rohan with the heart of a warrior, she tends to her uncle during his weakness and despairs at being left behind when the men ride to war.

8.description: A march-warden of Lothlórien who arrives at Helm's Deep with a company of Elven archers to aid in the defense. His presence shows the alliance between Elves and Men.

13.description: A Black Númenórean who serves as Sauron's messenger and lieutenant. Guards the Black Gate of Mordor with fell power and speaks for his master to all who would enter.

16.description: One of the Istari wizards, focused on beasts and birds rather than the affairs of Men and Elves. Lives in Rhosgobel and aids Gandalf by sending messages through his animal friends.
Ancient king of Gondor and Arnor who cut the One Ring from Sauron's hand but failed to destroy it. His line continues through Aragorn, the rightful heir to both kingdoms.
The Lord of Rivendell and keeper of Vilya, mightiest of the Three Rings of the Elves. Master of healing and lore, he has guided the defense against darkness for ages.
Daughter of Elrond and beloved of Aragorn. Called Undómiel (Evenstar) for her beauty. Her love gives Aragorn hope and purpose in his quest to reclaim his throne.

6.description: A great horse of Rohan given to Aragorn by King Théoden. Swift and strong, he serves faithfully as Aragorn's mount during the journey to Helm's Deep and beyond.

recaps.1: Boromir dies defending Merry and Pippin from Uruk-hai, but the hobbits are captured. Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli swear to pursue their captors and rescue their friends.
recaps.2: The Three Hunters pursue the Uruk-hai across Rohan. They encounter Éomer's company, who report destroying the orc-band but finding no hobbits among the dead.
recaps.3: The hunters find evidence that the hobbits escaped into Fangorn Forest during the battle. They enter the forest and encounter a mysterious old man they first mistake for Saruman.
recaps.4: The old man is revealed to be Gandalf, returned as Gandalf the White after his battle with the Balrog. Meanwhile, Merry and Pippin are rescued by Treebeard the Ent.
recaps.5: Gandalf reunites with Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli. He explains his death and resurrection, and his new role as head of the White Council. They ride to Edoras.
recaps.6: At Edoras, Gandalf breaks Saruman's spell over King Théoden, restoring the king's strength and will. Wormtongue is revealed as Saruman's spy and flees.
recaps.7: Théoden decides to lead his people to the ancient fortress of Helm's Deep for safety. The company rides to the stronghold as Saruman's army approaches.
recaps.8: The Battle of the Hornburg begins as Saruman's vast army of Uruk-hai assaults Helm's Deep. The fortress is besieged through the night with desperate fighting.
recaps.9: The battle reaches its climax as the fortress walls are breached. At dawn, Gandalf arrives with Erkenbrand and reinforcements, routing Saruman's army.
recaps.10: The Ents attack Isengard in their wrath over Saruman's destruction of the forests. Orthanc tower is surrounded by flood waters as the Ents dam the river.
recaps.11: Frodo and Sam capture Gollum, who has been following them. Despite Sam's misgivings, Frodo accepts Gollum's oath to guide them toward Mordor.
recaps.12: Gollum leads the hobbits through the Dead Marshes, where phantom faces of ancient warriors appear in the stagnant waters. They approach the Black Gate of Mordor.
recaps.13: Finding the Black Gate impregnable and heavily guarded, the hobbits allow Gollum to lead them by a secret way he knows. They head south toward Ithilien.
recaps.14: In Ithilien, Frodo and Sam witness a battle between Southrons and Rangers of Gondor. They are captured by Faramir, who reveals himself as Boromir's brother.
recaps.15: Faramir brings the hobbits to the hidden base of Henneth Annûn. Unlike his brother, he resists the temptation of the Ring and aids them on their mission.
recaps.16: Gandalf and the others parley with Saruman at Orthanc. Gandalf breaks Saruman's staff and casts him from the White Council. Wormtongue throws a palantír from the tower.
recaps.17: Pippin looks into the palantír and has a brief mental contact with Sauron himself. Gandalf takes the hobbit and rides swiftly toward Minas Tirith.
recaps.18: Aragorn reveals himself to Sauron through the palantír, challenging the Dark Lord and wresting control of the seeing-stone. He sees a fleet of black ships approaching.
recaps.19: Aragorn takes the Paths of the Dead with Legolas and Gimli, seeking to summon the oath-breaking dead to fulfill their ancient pledge.
recaps.20: The Dead follow Aragorn to the port of Pelargir, where they defeat the Corsairs. Aragorn releases them from their curse, and reinforcements from southern Gondor join him.
recaps.21: Faramir releases Frodo and Sam at the borders of Mordor. Gollum leads them to a secret entrance - the tunnel of Torech Ungol, lair of the giant spider Shelob.
